meanings.definition: Relating to the nerves and senses.
meanings.sent1: The neurosensory experience of feeling a gentle breeze on your skin is delightful.
meanings.sent2: The doctor studied the patient's neurosensory responses to different stimuli.
meanings.sent3: The neurosensory overload from the loud music made her dance uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: His neurosensory perception was so acute, he could almost taste the colors.
meanings.sent5: The neurosensory details of the painting brought it to life in his mind.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the nervous system and sensory organs.
meanings.sent1: The neurosensory signals from the brain help us understand our surroundings.
meanings.sent2: The neurosensory examination revealed abnormalities in the patient's vision.
meanings.sent3: The neurosensory feedback loop between the eyes and the brain is fascinating.
meanings.sent4: Her neurosensory awareness was like a finely tuned instrument, picking up every detail.
meanings.sent5: The neurosensory connection between smell and memory is powerful and evocative.
